pr_title: [RW-4314][risk=no] Gauge metric for GSuite Domain Account Count

timeline.bodyText: I don't know of a good way to write a reasonable test case for this logic
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: Do we have a place in the GSuite Admin UI where I can verify this value? Looks like 660 for fake-research-aou.org.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: I don't see an easy way - best thing I found is to go to the users page, then "download users" to get them as CSV:
replies.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: custom view type with a projection of just primaryEmail is probably better, as you mention in your PR description - especially if this is running frequently. I also don't see a better API for counting
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText:
I don't see a way to use only a subset fo the basic fields. Looks like projection and customFieldMask only deal with hiding selected custom fields.
https://developers.google.com/admin-sdk/directory/v1/reference/users/list
This only runs every minute. I don't see a rate limit specifically for this list API or any other read-only operations at https://developers.google.com/admin-sdk/directory/v1/limits
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Ah, I see that it doesn't apply to the basic fields - misunderstood the docs for this. Yeah - sounds fine.
replies.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: This domain restriction is correct, but not the target we want to directly alert on. The gsuite user capacity is dictated by the total number of users in a gsuite domain - which for fake-research-aou.org covers test, perf, staging, stable. So the alert would need to be driven on the sum of those user counts. So you'd need to either sum these values together across projects and alert on that (if that's possible), or just remove the domain restriction here, or else export both of these metrics but only alert on the total gsuite count.
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText:
IIUC, we are on the right track. The gauge will fire for all environments, and we'll be able to distinguish those based on the namespace and the project_id in the resource descriptor.
Where it gets tricky is that those environments today are in separate Stackdriver Workspaces, meaning we can't see all those counts in one place to apply some kind of formula. I'm quietly pushing for a bit more investigation of moving things to a single workspace, but the catch is that no project can be in more than one workspace at a time.
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: If that's not possible today, then I'd suggest just dropping this filter and have the metric represent "the total number of users in the corresponding gsuite domain". The metric would be identical in all environments which share a gsuite instance, and would be larger than the actual user count for the environment.
replies.author: calbach

replies.bodyText:
I can give both with different labels.
For perf, instead of perf.fake-research-aou.org, you would just get fake-research-aou.org.
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: the formatter butchered this a bit, probably move the comment before the enum value instead
timeline.author: calbach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -10,9 +10,12 @@
 public enum MetricLabel implements MetricLabelBase {
   BUFFER_ENTRY_STATUS("BufferEntryStatus", Enums.getValueStrings(BufferEntryStatus.class)),
   DATASET_INVALID("Invalid", Booleans.VALUE_STRINGS),
+  DATA_ACCESS_LEVEL("DataAccessLevel", Enums.getValueStrings(DataAccessLevel.class)),
+  GSUITE_DOMAIN(
+      "gsuite_domain"), // provide this (slightly redundant) in case we ever merge time series

timeline.message: report both lower-level and upper-level domains, if present
factor out a bit of common code

timeline.bodyText: I'll have to wait for this to deploy to another environment where the top isn't the same as the environment domain to verify this logic.
timeline.author: jaycarlton
